abstract: Should Verizon Communications successfully buy out Vodafone’s 45 percent stake in Verizon Wireless — analysts suggest that the transaction would be valued at more than $125 billion — it would consummate one of the largest takeovers on record.
snippet: Should Verizon Communications successfully buy out Vodafone’s 45 percent stake in Verizon Wireless — analysts suggest that the transaction would be valued at more than $125 billion — it would consummate one of the largest takeovers on record.
lead_paragraph: Though deal makers often complain about the slow pace of business in the summer, it appears that one of the biggest takeovers in years is near.

headline.main: Verizon-Vodafone Deal Would Be a Big Payday for Deal Makers

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Verizon Communications is in talks with Vodafone to buy the British telecommunication giant’s 45% stake in Verizon Wireless. The deal, worth at least $125 billion, would be one of the biggest takeovers in history, but the burgeoning wireless industry makes the buyout attractive.

headline.main: Week in Review: A $125 Billion Bet on a Multitrillion-Dollar Market
